description: GroupMe is a free group messaging app. A free and simple way to stay in touch with friends and family, quickly and easily.

blocks.name: listGroups
blocks.description: List the authenticated user's active groups.

args.name: page
args.info: Fetch a particular page of results. Defaults to 1.

blocks.name: listFormerGroups
blocks.description: List they groups you have left but can rejoin.

args.name: page
args.info: Fetch a particular page of results. Defaults to 1.

blocks.name: getSingleGroup
blocks.description: Load a specific group.

blocks.name: createGroup
blocks.description: Create a new group

args.name: groupName
args.info: Primary name of the group. Maximum 140 characters

args.name: groupDescription
args.info: A subheading for the group. Maximum 255 characters

args.name: shareGroup
args.info: If you pass a true value for share, we'll generate a share URL. Anybody with this URL can join the group.

blocks.name: updateGroup
blocks.description: Update existing group

args.name: groupName
args.info: Primary name of the group. Maximum 140 characters

args.name: groupDescription
args.info: A subheading for the group. Maximum 255 characters

args.name: shareGroup
args.info: If you pass a true value for share, we'll generate a share URL. Anybody with this URL can join the group.

blocks.name: deleteGroup
blocks.description: Delete a specific group.

blocks.name: joinSharedGroup
blocks.description: Join a shared group

blocks.name: rejoinSharedGroup
blocks.description: Rejoin a group. Only works if you previously removed yourself.

blocks.name: changeGroupOwners
blocks.description: Change owner of requested groups.

args.name: requests
args.info: One request is object where user_id is the new owner who must be active member of a group specified by group_id.

blocks.name: addMembers
blocks.description: Add members to a group.  The response includes a results_id that's used in the results request.

args.name: members
args.info: nickname is required. You must use one of the following identifiers: user_id, phone_number, or email.

blocks.name: getAddResults
blocks.description: Get the membership results from an add call.

blocks.name: removeMember
blocks.description: Remove a member (or yourself) from a group.

blocks.name: updateNickname
blocks.description: Update your nickname in a group. The nickname must be between 1 and 50 characters.

blocks.name: listGroupMessages
blocks.description: Retrieve messages for a group.

args.name: beforeId
args.info: Returns messages created before the given message ID

args.name: sinceId
args.info: Returns most recent messages created after the given message ID

args.name: afterId
args.info: Returns messages created immediately after the given message ID

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of messages returned. Default is 20. Max is 100.

blocks.name: sendTextMessage
blocks.description: Send a text message to a group

args.name: sourceGuid
args.info: Client-side IDs for messages. This can be used by clients to set their own identifiers on messages, but the server also scans these for de-duplication. That is, if two messages are sent with the same source_guid within one minute of each other, the second message will fail with a 409 Conflict response.

args.name: attachments
args.info: A polymorphic list of attachments (locations, images, etc). You may have more than one of any type of attachment, provided clients can display it.

blocks.name: sendAttachmentMessage
blocks.description: Send a message with attachment and optional text to a group

args.name: sourceGuid
args.info: Client-side IDs for messages. This can be used by clients to set their own identifiers on messages, but the server also scans these for de-duplication. That is, if two messages are sent with the same source_guid within one minute of each other, the second message will fail with a 409 Conflict response.

args.name: attachments
args.info: A polymorphic list of attachments (locations, images, etc). You may have more than one of any type of attachment, provided clients can display it.

blocks.name: listChats
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of direct message chats, or conversations, sorted by updated_at descending.

args.name: page
args.info: Fetch a particular page of results. Defaults to 1.

blocks.name: listDirectMessages
blocks.description: Fetch direct messages between two users.

args.name: otherUserId
args.info: The other participant in the conversation.

args.name: beforeId
args.info: Returns messages created before the given message ID

args.name: sinceId
args.info: Returns most recent messages created after the given message ID

blocks.name: sendDirectTextMessage
blocks.description: Send a text DM to another user

args.name: recipientId
args.info: The other participant in the conversation.

args.name: sourceGuid
args.info: Client-side IDs for messages. This can be used by clients to set their own identifiers on messages, but the server also scans these for de-duplication. That is, if two messages are sent with the same source_guid within one minute of each other, the second message will fail with a 409 Conflict response.

args.name: attachments
args.info: A polymorphic list of attachments (locations, images, etc). You may have more than one of any type of attachment, provided clients can display it.

blocks.name: sendDirectAttachmentMessage
blocks.description: Send a DM to another user with attachment and options text

args.name: recipientId
args.info: The other participant in the conversation.

args.name: sourceGuid
args.info: Client-side IDs for messages. This can be used by clients to set their own identifiers on messages, but the server also scans these for de-duplication. That is, if two messages are sent with the same source_guid within one minute of each other, the second message will fail with a 409 Conflict response.

args.name: attachments
args.info: A polymorphic list of attachments (locations, images, etc). You may have more than one of any type of attachment, provided clients can display it.

blocks.name: likeMessage
blocks.description: Like a message.

blocks.name: unlikeMessage
blocks.description: Unlike a message.

blocks.name: listLikedMessages
blocks.description: A list of the liked messages in the group for a given period of time. Messages are ranked in order of number of likes.

blocks.name: listMyLikes
blocks.description: A list of messages you have liked. Messages are returned in reverse chrono-order. Note that the payload includes a liked_at timestamp in ISO-8601 format.

blocks.name: listLikesForMe
blocks.description: A list of messages others have liked.

blocks.name: createBot
blocks.description: Create a bot.

blocks.name: sendBotMessage
blocks.description: Post a message from a bot

args.name: picture
args.info: Image must be processed through image service.

blocks.name: listBots
blocks.description: List bots that you have created

blocks.name: deleteBot
blocks.description: Remove a bot that you have created

blocks.name: getMyInfo
blocks.description: Get details about the authenticated user

blocks.name: updateMyInfo
blocks.description: Update attributes about your own account

args.name: avatarUrl
args.info: URL to valid JPG/PNG/GIF image. URL will be converted into an image service link (https://i.groupme.com/....)

args.name: name
args.info: Name must be of the form FirstName LastName

args.name: email
args.info: Email address. Must be in name@domain.com form.

blocks.name: enableSMSMode
blocks.description: Enables SMS mode for N hours, where N is at most 48. After N hours have elapsed, user will receive push notfications.

args.name: registrationId
args.info: The push notification ID/token that should be suppressed during SMS mode. If this is omitted, both SMS and push notifications will be delivered to the device.

blocks.name: disableSMSMode
blocks.description: Disables SMS mode

blocks.name: listBlockedUsers
blocks.description: A list of contacts you have blocked. These people cannot DM you.

blocks.name: checkIfBlocked
blocks.description: Asks if a block exists between you and another user id

blocks.name: createBlock
blocks.description: Creates a block between you and the contact

blocks.name: deleteBlock
blocks.description: Removes block between you and other user
